image.altText: Laura sits outside and looks seriously into the camera.

props.synopsis: A new report by victim-led advocacy organisation With You We Can makes the case for all victim-survivors of sexual violence to have access to independent legal representation.

title.children: Laura felt unsupported in the justice system. She wants that to change

image.altText: ACT Magistrate Court

props.synopsis: The first person sentenced for a sexual offence after a major review of cases previously rejected by ACT Police has had an appeal over his sentence dismissed.

title.children: Court dismisses appeal against man jailed for raping friend

image.altText: Police tape in front of a street with a house and cars in background.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating after a 71-year-old man who allegedly shot at officers during an attempted arrest was later found dead on a property in Canberra's south.

title.children: Man who allegedly shot at police during DV-related arrest found dead

image.altText: Hands hold a phone with the screen turned up.

props.synopsis: Luke was only minutes into his first shift at his new workplace when he began hearing his colleagues making homophobic comments. Despite being a resident of Australia's most progressive city, he says he no longer feels safe in public.

title.children: In Australia's most progressive city, Luke quit his job because of homophobia

image.altText: A delicate yellow orchid flower, on the end of its green stem.

props.synopsis: Australian cemeteries have become a safe haven for flora and fauna affected by urban expansion, including a rare orchid unique to a small patch of the NSW Mid North Coast.

title.children: Rare orchids and wattles thrive in old cemeteries

image.altText: People holding Australian flags outside Parliament House in Canberra.

props.synopsis: Sovereign citizens are clogging up Australian courts, after the global financial crisis and COVID-19 spurred a surge in the group's numbers in Australia.

title.children: A growing number of sovereign citizens are clogging up courts

image.altText: A young Lebanese man bushwalking.

props.synopsis: A community-led hiking program is introducing migrants to the bush, offering moments of connection, discovery and, for some, a sense of safety.

title.children: 27 migrants went bushwalking hoping to shatter some myths

image.altText: A satellite image of Australia with a large mass of cloud at the top.

props.synopsis: Cyclone Fina has hit the coastline of far northern Western Australia as a category three system.

title.children: Cyclone Fina hits remote parts of WA

props.synopsis: New data shows some patients with serious mental health conditions have been waiting more than 23 hours for a bed in emergency departments.

title.children: 'These are real humans': More mental health patients ending up in EDs

image.altText: An older man with thinning grey hair wears a dark suit as he stands and speaks.

props.synopsis: Macarthur MP Mike Freelander believes the multi-partisan support for restricting gambling advertising means the reforms will "get there" eventually.

title.children: Gambling ad ban would pass parliament with conscience vote, Labor MP says

image.altText: Photo of Gus

props.synopsis: In their effort to find missing four-year-old Gus, police have vowed "explore every avenue" — which now includes several mine shafts around the property where he disappeared.

title.children: Gus search to begin as police vow to 'explore every avenue'

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy, wearing black, speaks in front of a Ukrainian flag

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warns his country's borders "cannot be changed by force", highlighting a key sticking point in negotiations with the US over a potential peace deal with Russia.

title.children: Zelenskyy warns Ukraine's borders 'cannot be changed by force'

image.altText: Donald Trump and Xi Jinping talk as they leave after a bilateral meeting in South Korea

props.synopsis: Chinese state media reported some of what was discussed in the phone call that took place on Monday, local time.

title.children: Taiwan's 'return to China' key to international order, Xi tells Trump

image.altText: A woman stands outside a cafe

props.synopsis: While Porepunkah residents are trying to move on from the tragic deaths of two police officers, there is one person they are eager to forget.

title.children: As Porepunkah tries to move on, one name remains too painful to hear

image.altText: A large crowd of people holding signs while marching in front of Queensland parliament.

props.synopsis: Parents and guardians have been asked to "make alternative plans" for their children as Queensland teachers walk off the job after rejecting pay offer.

title.children: 'Thank the premier': Teachers strike across Qld for second time this year

image.altText: A person sits in a cell, as seen through a heavy door with a barred viewing window in it.

props.synopsis: The family of a dying man asked for his records from Tasmania's only youth detention centre, Ashley. They were told it could take eight months — time he does not have.

title.children: Terminally ill man in race against time to access records of child imprisonment

image.altText: Marilyn Warren, who has short brown hair, poses for a photo wearing a cream blazer

props.synopsis: Marilyn Warren made history when she was appointed chief justice of the Supreme Court of Victoria, though she has never thought of herself as a trailblazer.

title.children: She was a trailblazer for women in law. Her gender was, at times, a burden

image.altText: A still image from a TV show depicts a man with a mullet disarming a bomb with one second remaining until detonation.

props.synopsis: Every question has only two options, one is right and the other is wrong. You have an even chance of guessing correctly each time.

title.children: Try our new 50-50 quiz: Every question is an even chance

image.altText: Michael Wilkinson, 55, in glasses, adjusts a white wedding gown costume worn by Bronte Carmichael, 15.

props.synopsis: Michael Wilkinson won an Emmy for his intricate costumes in the celebrated Star Wars series Andor. Now, he is recreating 1880s America for Death By Lightning.

title.children: Designing Andor's costumes required building an entire world

image.altText: Roof off house at Bribie Island

props.synopsis: Lightning, destructive winds and hail have hit large parts of the state, with more than 150,000 homes losing power.

title.children: Giant hail hits parts of south-east Queensland

image.altText: Donald Trump places a hand on his chest.

props.synopsis: Trump cares little for alliances. So his presidency could well offer a priceless gift to Australia: a rare moment when national self-interest can eclipse sentiment.

title.children: Trump putting America first could be a priceless gift to Australia

image.altText: A girl holds on to a cardboard box labelled "GHF" while sitting on a cart

props.synopsis: More than 800 Palestinians died in the vicinity of Gaza Humanitarian Foundation aid sites after it took over the distribution of all supplies in the strip in May.

title.children: Controversial Israel and US-backed Gaza aid organisation closes

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair in a pink shirt and black skirt stands with her arm around a man in a blue shirt in a wheelchair.

props.synopsis: Stunt pilot Glenn Collins says he is excited but daunted as he faces "the biggest rehab of my life — going home".

title.children: Avalon Airshow stunt pilot returns home eight months after crash

image.altText: Open cut coal mine

props.synopsis: Yancoal begins plans to extend the life of its central Queensland coal mine, which would see roughly 74 million tonnes of coal extracted over the life of the mine.

title.children: Chinese-backed mining company looks to extend coal mine to 2070

image.altText: Ash Riddell holds her medal

props.synopsis: Runner-up to Adelaide's Ebony Marinoff last year, Riddell polled 23 votes to add the league's highest individual honour to her fifth All-Australian selection.

title.children: Kangaroos star Ash Riddell wins AFLW best and fairest award

image.altText: Two bystanders look on at helicopter crash scene.

props.synopsis: First responders have recounted the "absolute chaos" after two Sea World helicopters crashed in 2023, killing four people.

title.children: Inquest hears of 'absolute chaos' after deadly Sea World helicopter crash

image.altText: Pauline Hanson wearing a burka walks out of the Senate with members of One Nation.

props.synopsis: The rare break in proceedings came after One Nation's Pauline Hanson strode into the chamber wearing a burka and then refused to leave after being slapped with a sanction.

title.children: Senate shut down for 1.5 hours after Pauline Hanson's burka stunt

image.altText: a person sits at a desk looking at the new Bureau of Meteorology website

props.synopsis: The Bureau of the Meteorology's new chief executive has blamed a "miscommunication" for the furore that has erupted over a costly and controversial website redesign.

title.children: BOM boss reveals $96.5m website rebuild approved by Turnbull government

image.altText: Shooters, Fishers and Farmers Carlo Di Falco

props.synopsis: Key figures in Tasmania's Shooters, Fishers and Farmers Party have quit following new MP Carlo Di Falco's backflip on the Macquarie Point Stadium project.

title.children: Hobart stadium backflip sparks row in Shooters, Fishers, Farmers party

image.altText: A low wide shot of a fluffy brown dog on a leash which looks huge compared to the silhouetted person sitting on a beach.

props.synopsis: Animals and objects dwarf humans in Gavin Libotte's unique perspective on suburban life, challenging the way we see the familiar world.

title.children: 'Magic in the mundane' for Sydney photographer unearthing childlike wonder

image.altText: A billboard that says "Future Mt Atkinson Town Centre" stands before a greenfield site in a country area.

props.synopsis: Locals are frustrated by hold-ups with a long-awaited shopping strip in Mt Atkinson, in Melbourne's major growth corridor in the west.

title.children: Is public consultation the reason this shopping centre has been delayed?

image.altText: Words reading "Artificial intelligence AI", miniature of robot and toy hand are pictured

props.synopsis: 'AI slop' refers to low-quality content created by generative AI which often contains errors and is not requested by the user, according to Macquarie.

title.children: Macquarie Dictionary names 'AI slop' as word of the year 2025

image.altText: A man wearing a suit speaks to someone out of frame against a black background

props.synopsis: India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi is one of many to pay tribute to the icon of Indian cinema.

title.children: Bollywood superstar Dharmendra dies aged 89

image.altText: A profile photo of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro.

props.synopsis: The designation is the latest measure in the Trump administration's escalating campaign to combat drug trafficking into the US.

title.children: US labels Maduro-tied Cartel de los Soles a terror organisation

image.altText: NSW Police attend a fatal stabbing at Rouse Hill

props.synopsis: NSW Police said two young boys were at a reserve at Rouse Hill when they were approached by three other boys about 4:20pm on Monday.

title.children: 15yo boy charged with murder after teen dies in Sydney stabbing
